title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 363-6.4 - Bedrock separation

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 363-6.4 - Bedrock separation

State Regulations
A minimum of ten feet of vertical separation is required
between bedrock and the base of the constructed liner at all points along the
liner system, except as provided in section
363-6.11
(a)(4)
of
this Part. The material between the base of the constructed liner and bedrock, whether natural or backfilled, is subject to department approval. The material
must consist of low permeability soils with silty and clayey characteristics
and with the ability to attenuate and absorb contaminants. Notes
